structural_strengths: Causal chains are airtight - every major plot point earns its place
Tentpoles deliver promised impact, especially Ch 12 which is exceptional
Character arcs complete satisfyingly (Sarah, Marcus, David, Janet, Yuki all have clear trajectories)
Thematic coherence excellent - collapsed vs superposition explored throughout
No true filler chapters - every chapter serves plot or character function
Act structure solid with appropriate pacing
Planted elements mostly pay off (8/10 perfect, 2 need minor strengthening)
Bridge chapters earn their place between tentpoles
Ending doesn't tie everything neatly, which is thematically appropriate
weaknesses_summary: Two planted elements (ontological pressure, Sarah's prior scan) need explicit early mentions
Minor character naming inconsistencies in early chapters
One bridge chapter (Ch 14) could be 10-15% tighter
Very minor loose threads (Patricia Reyes, researcher deaths) - acceptable but could be addressed
overall_verdict: EXCELLENT STRUCTURE - This is a remarkably well-constructed 20-chapter novel. The plot architecture is sound, causal chains are strong, tentpoles deliver, and character arcs complete. The two main weaknesses (ontological pressure and prior scan planting) are easily fixed with single-sentence additions. The story reads as complete and satisfying while maintaining appropriate uncertainty. Recommend publication-ready after addressing the two HIGH priority planted element fixes.
